item.description:

  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained glass bottles and three were broken spilling contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024020902
item.description:
Report X-2024020902

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A smoking non-spillable battery was found with a punctured fiberboard box and battery casing on the flexslide around 4pm. The carton was placed in a lined tote and bought to the HWPA where it was placed under the vent and watched until it cooled down. DescribePack: The battery was leaking and smoking from a hole in its side and appears to have shorted. No terminal covers or inner packaging were found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The battery was carefully placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWPA, where it was placed under the ventilation hood and observed. Proper PPE was worn.

item.title: Report X-2024020675
item.description:
Report X-2024020675

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found on unload, all spillage removed from operations and staged for HMPA. DescribePack: One of two 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.7 gallon of fluid via a crack/fissure in the seam of the bottom corner (handle side). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024020418
item.description:
Report X-2024020418

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020418 SequenceEvent: Once the package was brought to our attention and acknowledged to be a regulated hazmat, it was placed into a plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional damage. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The entirety of the box was covered in the delimer, causing it to rip and tear apart. One of the bottles had a loosened cap that leaked through. The rest of the bottles were soiled in the delimer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional spillage. 2. X-2024020420 SequenceEvent: Once the package was brought to our attention and it was acknowledged that it was a regulated hazmat; the package was placed into a plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional release. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: There were several patches of wetness on the top and bottom of the box. Two of the bottles had loosened caps that resulted in a mild leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a plastic bag and then into a tote to mitigate any additional leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020737
item.description:
Report X-2024020737

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-28
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Once the package was brought to our attention, it was promptly placed into a hazardous plastic bag and into a red tote. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The exterior of the box had a stains from the product. Two of the bottles appeared to look like they were sealed however when tilted, the product would leak through the sealants. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a hazardous plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024020458
item.description:
Report X-2024020458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, corroding box found on unload, capacity 2 x 1 gallon. Package removed from operations, taken to HMPA in lined tote. One printed orientation arrow obscured by package labels. DescribePack: One of two 1-gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.1 gallon from leakage due to internal corrosion of safety seal under cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024020457
item.description:
Report X-2024020457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-20
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found upside down on unload despite orientation arrows and vented cap warning printed on side of overpack fiberboard box. Two 5 Liter plastic jerricans of Medivators Rapicide PA Part A (haz) and two of part B (nonhaz). Package placed in lined tote and transferred to HMPA. DescribePack: Two of two 5 Liter plastic jerricans of Part A lost 0.8 Liter of fluid due to mishandling. Caps appeared tightly secured but vented while package was upside down. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the package was brought to our attention, it was quickly placed into a plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional spillage. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The cap of the 1-gallon bottle was completely off which resulted in a leakage of the flammable liquid. The entirety of the inside of the box was soiled in the gel. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024010839
item.description:
Report X-2024010839

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON Jan 27th during the PM sort a package was found to be leaking a while substance. The package was marked as UN1263 Paint, 3, PGII!. It appears that the secondary containment failed when the can inside was damaged causing the lid to come off. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and an amended shippers declaration was requested from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024020518
item.description:
Report X-2024020518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded onto the overhead conveyor belt. The package was then dropped down the ADM shoot and rollers, wet and leaking. The package was then placed into a plastic and then into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any additional leakage. The tote was transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: Two of the 1-gallon bottles had loose caps which resulted in a leakage. The package was semi-wet from the spilled product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic bag and then into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put inside a plastic bag and a black tote

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 01/26/2024 at approximately 1235, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5007286 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a spill oil shipment. The shipment consited of one fiberboard box containing 9 bottles of scented oil. It appears that closures were not secured on the bottles, resulting in complete spillage and total loss of shipment.

item.title: Report E-2024020086
item.description:
Report E-2024020086

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, one (!) 5-gallon drum of UN1263 was damaged in transit due to unprotected freight and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the sealant-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents as well as the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.
